meanings.definition: Tearers (noun): People or things that tear or rip something apart.
meanings.sent1: The tearers quickly tore the paper into small pieces.
meanings.sent2: The naughty puppy was a little tearer, always ripping up socks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous tearers in the movie tore through the treasure map too fast.
meanings.sent4: The storm acted like a group of tearers, tearing down trees in its path.
meanings.sent5: The tearers in the haunted house made it look like a torn-up mess.

meanings.definition: Tearers (adjective): Describing something that causes tears or rips.
meanings.sent1: The sharp claws of the cat were tearers, causing small tears in the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The old book had tearers pages that needed delicate handling.
meanings.sent3: The tearers wind made the kite rip and tear in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The tearers thorns on the rose bush caught the gardener's sleeve.
meanings.sent5: The tearers edges of the paper cut my finger when I turned the page.
